III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS & CONCLUSIONS
A. Physical Description of Facility
The agency maintains an office in Lapeer, Michigan. The office provides sufficient
space to provide services by agency staff to clients and secure control of documents.
B. Program Description
The agency filed Articles of Incorporation as a non-profit organization on March 28,
2008, to provide adoption services. The agency intends to primarily serve the “Thumb”
area of eastern Michigan, though will consider other areas if staffing permits extending
the service area.
Upon obtaining a license to operate, the agency intends to apply for a contract through
the Michigan Department of Human Services (MDHS) to provide adoption placement
services to local county MDHS offices.
The agency administrator, Jacqueline Luzi, qualifies as the administrator through her
bachelor’s degree in psychology and 18 years experience in child welfare casework, the
past 15 years of which have been in adoption services.
The agency submitted policies and procedures during on-site visits of May 8 and 20,
2008. The agency’s policies and procedures complied with the requirements of Rules
400.12202, 400.12603, and 400.12703.
C. Rule/Statutory Violations: None
